poem:
**Missing Melody**

UK voices, once a tender thread,  
now a breeze, untwining—  
past markets and murmurs turn,  
seeking echoes in fading corners.  
Fame's fickle light shifts,  
yet songs linger in the air,  
soft as unpicked fruits, they wait,  
for whispers in quiet hearts,  
away from charts that forget,  
a nation's untold melody.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "UK pop stars fail to reach global Top 10 albums and singles chart for first time since 2003 British pop stars have failed to reach the worldwide annual charts of the year’s Top 10 biggest singles and albums for the first time in more than two decades. In 2022, UK acts such as Harry Styles and Glass Animals made up seven of the 20 entries in the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI) list.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: UK pop stars fail to reach global Top 10 albums and singles chart for first time since 2003 British pop stars have failed to reach the worldwide annual charts of the year’s Top 10 biggest singles and albums for the first time in more than two decades. In 2022, UK acts such as Harry Styles and Glass Animals made up seven of the 20 entries in the International Federation of the Phonographic Industry (IFPI) list.
